Question: How many children are on the bus now?
Body: 26 children were riding on the bus. At the bus stop 38 more children got on the bus.

Question: How many more chairs than tables do they have?
Body: They decided to hold the party in their backyard. They have 14 chairs for each set of table. If they have 9 sets of tables

Question: How big is each group?
Body: The bananas in Philip's collection are organized into 196 groups. If there are a total of 392 bananas in Philip's banana collection

Body: Because of the decision Sofia asked the students to suggest specific types of food. If 228 students suggested adding mashed potatoes 337 suggested adding bacon to the menu and 23 suggested adding tomatoes

Question: How many books have you already read?
Body: There are 20 different books in the ' crazy silly school ' series. If you are yet to read 5 of the books

Question: How many days would the soda bottles last?
Body: Debby bought 200 water bottles and 256 soda bottles when they were on sale. If she drank 312 water bottles and 4 soda bottles a day

Question: How many more kids did she play with on monday than on tuesday?
Body: Julia played tag with 19 kids on monday. She played tag with 18 kids on tuesday. She spent a total of 38 hours to play tag on both days.

Question: How deep was the water?
Body: After resting they decided to go for a swim. The depth of the water is 9 times Dean's height. If Ron is 15 feet tall and Dean is 6 feet shorter than Ron

Question: How many more movies do you still have to watch?
Body: There are 8 different movies and 21 different books in the ' crazy silly school ' series. If you read 7 of the books and watched 4 of the movies

Question: How much farther did the mouse jump than the grasshopper?
Body: The grasshopper, the frog and the mouse had a jumping contest. The grasshopper jumped 24 inches. The frog jumped 33 inches farther than the grasshopper and the mouse jumped 5 inches lesser than the frog.

Question: How many more cups of flour does she need to add?
Body: Mary is baking a cake. The recipe calls for 12 cups of flour 5 cups of sugar and 49 cups of salt. She already put in 11 cups of flour.

Question: How many buses are needed to take the trip?
Body: The school is planning a field trip. The school has 87 classrooms. There are 58 students in the school with each classroom having the same number of students. If there are 2 seats on each school bus.

Question: How many green peaches are in each basket?
Body: There are 2 baskets of peaches. Each basket has 4 red peaches and some more green peaches. If there are a total of 12 peaches in all baskets

Question: How much did his dad's strawberries weigh now?
Body: Marco and his dad went strawberry picking. Together they collected strawberries that weighed 22 pounds. On the way back Marco ' dad found 30 more pounds of strawberries. Marco's strawberries now weighed 36 pounds.

Question: How many boys did she give the marbles to?
Body: In Haley's class some boys love to play marbles. If Haley has 10 marbles and she gave 5 marbles to each boy

Question: How many students suggested bacon?
Body: Because of the decision Sofia asked the students to suggest specific types of food. 182 students suggested adding mashed potatoes while others suggested adding bacon to the menu. If 166 more students suggested adding bacon than those that suggested mashed potatoes

Body: Steven has 14 peaches. Jake has 6 fewer peaches than Steven and 3 more peaches than Jill.

Body: There are 4 different books and 17 different movies in the ' crazy silly school ' series. If you read 19 of the books and watched 7 of the movies

Body: There are 384 oranges and 192 bananas in Philip's collection. If the bananas are organized into 345 groups and oranges are organized into 16 groups

Question: How many action figures did he have initially on the shelf?
Body: Jerry had some action figures on a shelf in his room. Later he added 7 more action figures to the shelf. If there are a total of 10 action figures on his shelf now

Question: How many tomatoes and potatoes does he have left?
Body: A farmer had 177 tomatoes and 12 potatoes in his garden. If he picked 53 tomatoes

Question: How many planks does John need for the house wall?
Body: For the walls of the house he would use 11 nails in all to secure large planks of wood. If each plank needs 3 pieces of nails to be secured and an additional 8 nails were used.

Body: Josh had 22 marbles in his collection. He found 13 marbles ones while he lost 5 marbles.

Question: How many pieces of candy had he eaten at the start?
Body: Bobby had 22 pieces of candy. He ate some pieces of candy. Then he ate 5 more. If he still has 8 pieces of candy left

Question: How many more cookies did he buy than those he ate?
Body: Paco had 13 cookies. He ate 2 of them. Then he bought 36 more cookies

Question: How many more children were on the bus before the bus stop than there are now?
Body: 41 children were riding on the bus. At the bus stop some children got off the bus. Then there were 18 children left on the bus.

Question: How many sweet cookies did Paco have left?
Body: Paco had 22 sweet cookies and 75 salty cookies. He ate 15 sweet cookies and 54 salty cookies.

Question: How many apples does Jackie have?
Body: Adam has 3 more apples than jackie. Adam has 9 apples.

Question: How many white t - shirts does each package have?
Body: White t - shirts can be purchased in packages. If mom buys 28 packages which contain 56 white t - shirts in total

Question: How much money did he spend buying the candy bar and chocolate?
Body: Dan has $ 4. He bought a candy bar for $ 7 and a chocolate for $ 6.

Question: How many bottle caps did he find at the park?
Body: After finding some bottle caps at the park danny has 32 bottle caps in his collection. If he had 25 bottle caps in his collection earlier

Body: Winter is almost here and most animals are migrating to warmer countries. 86 bird families flew away for the winter from near a mountain. If there were 45 bird families living near the mountain initially

Body: Faye was placing her pencils and crayons into 30 rows with 71 crayons and 24 pencils in each row.

Question: How many crackers and cakes did each person eat?
Body: Matthew gave equal numbers of crackers and cakes to his 28 friends. If he had 13 crackers and 15 cakes initially

Question: How many friends did he give crackers to?
Body: Matthew gave 6 crackers to each his friends. If he had 36 crackers

Question: How much does she weigh now?
Body: Jessie weighed 114 kilograms. After she started to go jogging everyday she lost 50 kilograms in the first week and 60 kilograms in the second week.

Question: How many minutes did the machine work yesterday?
Body: An industrial machine made 9 shirts yesterday and 44 shirts today. It can make 3 shirts a minute.

Question: How many pizzas did we order?
Body: We ordered some pizzas. Each pizza has 2 slices. If there were a total of 28 slices

Question: How much money did he spend to buy chocolate than he did to buy candy bar?
Body: Dan has $ 5. He bought a candy bar for $ 2 and a chocolate for $ 3.

Question: How many more bags did she find on the next day than she had on monday?
Body: Tiffany was collecting cans for recycling. On monday she had 7 bags of cans. The next day she found 12 more bags worth of cans.

Question: How many baskets of peaches are there?
Body: There are some baskets of peaches. Each basket has 4 red peaches and 3 green peaches. If there are a total of 7 peaches in all baskets

Question: How many more movies than books are there in the ' crazy silly school ' series?
Body: There are 8 different books and 10 different movies in the ' crazy silly school ' series. If you read 19 of the books and watched 61 of the movies

Body: If each pack costs 81 dollars

Body: After eating a hearty meal they went to see the Buckingham palace. There, Rachel learned that 317 visitors came to the Buckingham palace that day. If there were 295 visitors the previous day

Body: During summer break 819058 kids from Lawrence county go to camp and the other 668278 kids stay home.

Body: David did 51 push-ups in gym class today. David did 49 more push-ups than Zachary.

Body: Allan brought 5 balloons. If Allan and Jake brought total of 6 balloons to the park

Body: Danny collects bottle caps and wrappers. He found 66 wrappers and 39 bottle caps at the park. Now he has 16 bottle caps and 68 wrappers in his collection.

Body: A grocery store had 22 bottles of regular soda and 61 bottles of diet soda.

Body: Paul got a box of some crayons for his birthday. By the end of the school year he had either lost or given away 551 of them and only had 177 left.

Body: 7 red peaches, 15 yellow peaches and 8 green peaches are in the basket.

Body: Helen the hippo and her friends are preparing for thanksgiving at Helen's house. Helen baked 31 cookies yesterday 270 cookies this morning and 419 cookies the day before yesterday.

Question: How many bird families were left near the mountain?
Body: Winter is almost here and most animals are migrating to warmer countries. There are 3 bird families living near the mountain. 26 new bird families came to live near the mountain from the arctic while 2 bird families flew away further south for winter.

Body: The school is planning a field trip. The school has 72 classrooms. There are 3 seats on each school bus. If there are a total of 111 students in the school

Body: The ring toss game at the carnival made 144 dollars per day. They were at the carnival for 22 days.

Body: Danny collects bottle caps and wrappers. He found 65 wrappers and 5 bottle caps at the park. Now he has 31 bottle caps and 9 wrappers in his collection.

Body: Faye was placing her pencils into rows with 22 pencils in each row. She had 6 packs of pencils each one having 14 pencils.

Body: Danny collects bottle caps. He lost 66 bottle caps at the park. Now he has 25 bottle caps in his collection.
